Typography.StylisticAlternates="0"><Paragraph><Run xml:lang="nl-nl">In some respects, the Rangers have accomplished a lot, while in others, they've done absolutely nothing. After acquiring Martin St. Louis at the trade deadline, the expectationâ€”per trading a second round pick that could of (and became) a first if New York reach the Eastern Conference Finalsâ€”was that the Blueshirts would be one of the last four teams standing. And when you get to this point, there's only one finish that is truly satisfying: a Stanley Cup. Here are your morning notes.</Run></Paragraph><Paragraph><Run xml:lang="nl-nl"></Run></Paragraph><Paragraph><Run xml:lang="nl-nl">The Rangers have done well protecting leads during this postseason, and Sunday night was no different in a number of way. [Blueshirt Banter]</Run></Paragraph><Paragraph><Run xml:lang="nl-nl"></Run></Paragraph><Paragraph><Run xml:lang="nl-nl">With the Stanley Cup Finals only one win away, the Rangers know there's no reason to get complacent. [NY Post] [ESPN NY] [Daily News] [The Record]</Run></Paragraph><Paragraph><Run xml:lang="nl-nl"></Run></Paragraph><Paragraph><Run xml:lang="nl-nl">Derek Stepan's status for Game 5? It's still an unknown, while both Stepan, and Oscar Lindberg traveled with the team to Montreal with J.T. Miller nursing an upper body injury. [NY Post] [ESPN NY] [Rangers Rants] [Newsday]</Run></Paragraph><Paragraph><Run xml:lang="nl-nl"></Run></Paragraph><Paragraph><Run xml:lang="nl-nl">The trades the Rangers made this season are paying major dividends as the playoffs drag on.
